title: AITA for not letting my dad watch a film I've seen over 10 times?
self_text: My dad (68) has been going through some stuff recently and he's been really into watching movies to keep his mind off things, which is great! However, I've watched the film in question about 12 times now, so he asked me if he could watch it with me.  I said no but he kept asking and I told him "you're gonna hate it". He didn't seem to care and just kept asking. So I went on my phone, opened up my browser and played the film. When he tried to play it from his device he got an error message that said "invalid file". After looking at his device I realised he was trying to play the file without the correct codecs installed.  I told him that his device doesn't have the right codec installed and that it won't work.  He then looked at his phone again and I saw that he had found a YouTube video of the same film.   He started watching it.  I sat next to him as he watched and we both agreed it was awful. But still he kept telling me how much he loved it. I don't think he actually understood what was happening or the reason why he couldn't watch it from his device.  My mom has been saying that I should let him watch it because he wants to. She says that I am being selfish and childish. She also added that I shouldn't be getting angry when he asks me these questions.  I feel like I did nothing wrong and I don't want to let him ruin his experience. Am I the asshole?

title: is there a way to make my hair look more like the movie “The Matrix”?
self_text: I am trying to get a sleek, slicked-back hairstyle that resembles Neo’s in “The Matrix,” but my hair is naturally curly and won’t lay down flat. It's a medium length cut, so it has some volume at the top. Is there anything I can do to make it work?  I have brown, wavy hair.

title: Is it okay to ask a girl out on her birthday?
self_text: My friend said that its not a good idea, but I don't know why. She was born on December 26th and today is the 27th. So I was thinking of asking her out now if she's free or something like that. What do you guys think?

title: AITA for getting upset when my best friend left me out of a group trip?
self_text: I (18F) have been friends with my best friend, Alex (19M), since like 6th grade. We've always done everything together and we are super close. Over the summer, Alex told me that he was going on a camping trip to the mountains with 5 other people from our school. They were planning it for weeks and all of them were super excited about it.   I asked if I could come along but they said no because there wasn't room for everyone. I understood this, so I didn't get upset.  A few days later, Alex texted me saying that his dad had just got a new job in a different state and that he would be moving next month. He also said that he wanted to go on another trip before leaving so he invited me to join him on this trip as well. I was ecstatic and said yes immediately. I was looking forward to it so much!   The day of the trip came, and I was really excited to see Alex. When I got there, I saw him and his friends at the entrance of the trail head. I walked over to say hello and started talking to Alex. After about an hour, Alex told me that he needed to leave early because something came up and he couldn't stay longer than a few hours. He said that he had to go home to pack some things up. As he was walking away, I called out "I'll see you soon!" but he didn't hear me.   As I was leaving, I noticed that the others were laughing at something I said, which made me feel bad because I thought they were trying to be nice. I then realized that they didn't invite me or include me in anything they were doing. It was only after I was gone that I heard that they had spent the whole time playing games and telling jokes without ever even mentioning me. I felt incredibly hurt because I felt like Alex and his friends were intentionally excluding me. Then, I decided to text Alex to ask why he didn't tell me that he was going on a trip with other people. To this day, he hasn't responded to any of my texts. I was hoping that I wouldn't have to find out the reason through someone else, but now I am starting to wonder what went wrong. It was the first time that I felt betrayed by Alex.   So yeah, that's the story. Do I deserve this feeling of being upset or should I be more understanding?

title: AITA for not inviting my boyfriend's family to Christmas?
self_text: My bf, who I've been with for a year and live with for 6 months, has a super close relationship with his parents and sisters. They come over every week to see him. I'm not super close with them, but they are generally nice. This is the first year that he's brought his girlfriend to Christmas dinner. She was really nice and we got along well. It turned out she'd just started dating my bf last month so it wasn't like I was trying to exclude her from anything. I didn't invite her to Christmas dinner because she hadn't known us long enough yet and I thought it would be weird for her to be there, but I did bring her along to all of his family's other events. I felt bad about it at first, but then I realised it was only one Christmas dinner.  I feel like I'm an asshole if I don't invite her next year, but I also feel like I shouldn't have made her go to Christmas dinner in the first place. What do you think?

title: AITA for telling a coworker their idea was stupid?
self_text: I'm at a small company, and we have a lot of people working from home. My team is usually pretty good about helping each other out with ideas and brainstorming stuff, but my coworker has been coming up with some weird ideas lately. It started as an offhand comment in a meeting about how to help increase sales, but she went on and on about her idea for weeks. The thing is, it's so stupid that I feel like I can't even be polite to her about it. We were talking about what our next step should be (we were trying to come up with ways to engage more customers) and she said "We could make a TikTok video series about the benefits of our product." I thought that was a terrible idea because not many people would actually watch tiktok videos. So I told her "I don't think that'll work" and she replied "Why?" and I said "Because no one will watch tiktok videos." She then said "Well you just don't understand tiktok", which made me annoyed. At this point, I felt like I had to say something to shut her down, so I said "That's a really bad idea". I didn't mean to hurt her feelings or anything, and I apologized after saying it. She got angry and said she wanted to talk to my manager about it. I tried to explain why I thought it was such a dumb idea, but she wouldn't listen. Now I'm worried that my manager might think I'm being difficult or rude.  AITA?

title: AITA for giving a very simple request?
self_text: I got a new job, and my boss is a bit of an asshole. She’s really strict and doesn’t let you do anything without asking her first, even if it's something super basic. But she has this one coworker who does whatever she says, and the coworker isn’t doing his work correctly so the boss is constantly yelling at him to fix it or redo it, but he never seems to learn. So I asked the coworker to please just take care of his tasks properly so that we can all get on with our jobs. He said “okay” and did them correctly. My boss was furious and screamed at me to not make requests like that again because she would have to deal with them. It’s been a week since then and he still hasn’t made any mistakes. The coworker is being praised by the boss for being more helpful.  So basically, I think I’m in the wrong for making such a simple request?

title: How can I stop the sound of my phone from playing when it gets wet?
self_text: It happened to me last week and now the phone won't play sounds until it dries, even after a day. This is so annoying because it's always raining or snowing outside, so my phone will get wet pretty often.  How do I fix this issue?

title: When a guy at my school said he was going to the gym after school but then he came back and he looked so good I was shocked, I didn't know how to say anything to him, I just stared at him and he smiled and said "I was gonna ask you if you wanted to go with me".  Do you think we should go together?  I don't want to be too forward or whatever, but I really like his looks and he looks nice.
self_text: Do you think it's weird for me to think about going to the gym with a guy who has great looks? I'm not even sure why I'm asking because there is nothing wrong with wanting to have a nice time with someone who likes going to the gym.   If you think it's weird that I asked this question, it's because it's probably the first time you've been in a situation where you get to see a man who doesn't work out look so good.

title: Is it possible to find the perfect person?
self_text: I am a single guy and have been on dating apps for years but nothing seems to work out. I keep getting stuck in my head thinking if there is someone out there that would love me as much as I love them, or if I'm just not cut out to be with anyone. What are your thoughts?

title: Is it possible to live in a world where every single human being has been killed off?
self_text: I've been thinking about how the universe was created and all the things that have happened since then. If everything that ever existed is eventually going to be destroyed, what would happen when every single person dies? Would there be nothing left for it to become even more of a void?  Or would something new come out of the destruction?  Does time just stop or cease to exist when it reaches its end? Or will there be a sort of "reset" that begins again with the creation of another universe/timeline/world? Just some thoughts.

title: AITA for calling out a student?
self_text: I have been attending this school since kindergarten and I love it! The teachers are amazing and the kids are nice too. But recently, a new kid joined our class and he is kinda annoying. He always tries to get in my way when we're doing group projects and he never helps with anything.  The other day, I was walking to my locker after school and I saw him trying to open my locker. I called out "hey don't try to open my locker" and he got all defensive and started yelling at me saying I was being rude. I was so mad that I yelled back "I am not being rude, you are the one who keeps getting in my way!" and walked away. My teacher overheard us and told me to apologize. I did but I still think I wasn't wrong. What do you guys think? Am I the asshole?

title: How is it possible that there's a lot of people who think a specific brand is the best, and others can't see why?
self_text: I've been trying to find out how some people are so convinced they have the best product on the market. I'm not talking about "I like this brand better than another," I mean that they will tell you that their brand is objectively superior with no justification. It's like, how do they come to such a conclusion?

title: a slut in my class is taking an entire seat and it’s so annoying

title: a person is working out at home and the dog starts barking at them
self_text: They’re on their treadmill, just sweating away.  Then they hear it start… a low rumble that grows louder as they move. It’s a fucking dog.  At first they try to ignore it, but it’s relentless.  The dog has been trying to get to them for a few minutes now, but they keep walking. They have no choice now though. The dog is jumping up and down on the treadmill while they are running, yelling and making a huge ruckus. It’s so loud and distracting, the treadmill keeps going faster and faster as they get more frustrated. Then he bites his ankles as they stop running. He is really mad at them, so he tries to bite him again, but he misses. Finally he lets out an ear-splitting bark.

title: AITA for not going to school?
self_text: I live in a state that requires students to go to school every day, but my parents have been really strict about me being able to stay home when i'm sick or need a mental break (like the past few weeks). I've been getting really bad anxiety and panic attacks lately so I was hoping if I took some time off to work through it, it would help me with my studies later on. My parents think I'm just trying to get out of work and they don't understand why I need to take time off. They keep saying how important education is and how I should be grateful to even have an opportunity to learn. I hate that they are always putting down how much they expect from me.  I know I shouldn't be taking days off to deal with my anxiety but what am I supposed to do? I'm exhausted and I feel like I'm losing my mind.  AITA?

title: AITA for telling my parents that their relationship is toxic?
self_text: I'm 16 and my mom and dad have been in a relationship for about 3 years now, it started when I was 12 so I don't remember them dating before they got together but I do remember the whole process of them getting together. It didn't start off too bad, at first they were really sweet to each other, and we would all go on family trips or activities and it was always fun. But then things slowly went downhill, and now everything is just full of yelling and fighting and me being told that I can never see my friends because I'm "too busy" with school or that I can't ever leave my room because I'm "working too hard."  I think it started happening around last year when my dad lost his job and he was really upset and angry about it and my mom had to take up multiple jobs to make ends meet. He'd be working late nights and coming home exhausted and my mom would be stressed out trying to keep the house running and get me through school. Then when he finally got a new job he said he was going to work on himself and turn over a new leaf but nothing has changed. The same thing happens every single day. I've tried talking to both of them about how I feel, but they just shut me down. My dad says I'm being dramatic and doesn't understand what they're going through and my mom says I need to stop listening to my feelings and that I should be happy that they're together.  Today my dad was yelling at my mom again, saying that she's ruining his life and that he wishes she would just disappear. I couldn't take it anymore so I went into their bedroom and told them that I thought their relationship was toxic and that it was hurting everyone involved. They immediately started yelling at me, calling me disrespectful and ungrateful and saying that I'm not allowed in their bedroom anymore. Now I'm feeling guilty because I know I shouldn't have said those things, especially when they were having an argument and that I should just try to stay out of it. But I also know that I'm not wrong and that they need to address their problems and I don't want to live like this anymore. Am I the asshole for telling them how I felt?

title: a girl at my school is always getting bullied and I don't know what to do?

It's also getting to the point where I'm not even watching when they bully her anymore because it's too depressing.  I've tried telling some of my friends about it but they're all just saying "don't worry about it" or "just ignore them". This isn't ignoring them! They are literally bullying her with no regard for her feelings.  Is there anything that I can do to help? Like should I tell the teachers?

title: AITA for not wanting to deal with my mother's drama?
self_text: My mom is in a toxic relationship and she keeps constantly calling me about it. She calls me multiple times a day, texting me, or sending me Facebook messages trying to get me to take her side. I tried telling her that I don't want to be involved but she won't stop. She said something like "I know you care about me so you should help me" when she sent me a text. So I replied saying that I can't because it's not my job to take sides and that if she doesn't respect my boundaries then I am not going to continue dealing with her drama. Then she called me and started yelling at me saying I was being rude and that I was never there for her. She's always been the one who has left, so now that she's crying over someone else leaving, she thinks that it's okay to act like I owe her everything. I just wanna live my life without dealing with her drama. Is it AITA for not wanting to deal with her drama?

title: Why is the sound of a toilet flushing so loud?
self_text: I've always been wondering why toilet flush sounds like a gunshot, especially when it has a high volume.

title: AITA for telling my brother he needs to stop talking about his relationship?
self_text: My family is pretty small, just my mom and dad, my brother who’s 3 years older than me, and me. I’m 17 and he’s 20 so we don’t really hang out but we respect each other. He always talks about his girlfriend like it’s the only thing in the world which is annoying because she is a piece of shit. The problem is that they're both incredibly toxic and emotionally abusive towards each other, and frankly I think they should break up. So when he started talking about her again last night, I told him that I thought their relationship was terrible and that I thought they were hurting themselves. When I said that I knew he would get mad at me, so I apologized and left. He then sent me a message saying “You are such an asshole” and threatening to tell our parents about what I said. I know it was rude to say that, but honestly I feel like he deserves to hear it considering how awful he is. I didn’t mean to hurt his feelings, but I also felt like I needed to say something since it’s been going on for months now. My parents have never told us anything about them or if their relationship is okay so I’ve never felt comfortable saying anything myself.  AITA?

title: astra is like a normal person
self_text: I was at the mall with my friend and we went to see the movies. Then she asked me if I wanted to go to the food court. I said yes so we got in line for our order. When we were about to pay, her friend came up and said “I’m going to get some fries” then she turned around and started crying. At first, I didn’t know why she was crying but then she told me that it wasn't because of the fries. She told me she had just gotten dumped by her boyfriend. It was really sad and I tried to comfort her. We ended up leaving the food court and watching a movie together. As we were watching the movie, she kept saying how bad things were, but nothing seemed to change. Then she started screaming at me and asking why I never text her back. I told her I hadn’t been able to because my phone died. After that, she started to cry again. I tried to calm her down and tell her everything would be alright. But she wouldn’t stop crying. So, I did something stupid. I took out my phone and played music from spotify. Then I told her that I liked her hair and that I thought she looked really cute. She was quiet for a few seconds and then she screamed at me. I told her I wasn't trying to make her feel bad or anything. I was just being nice. She said "you think you're better than everyone else?" Then she started yelling and saying all kinds of insults. I apologized and said I didn't mean any harm. She continued to yell until the end of the movie. She left me alone after that and I was really confused. I walked home with my friend and we talked about everything. I noticed that when she said I didn’t like her hair, it was because she was insecure about herself. But she kept saying it over and over. She was always talking about how ugly and awkward she was. And then she went on and on about how much she hated her own life. She was so caught up in her own misery and insecurities. It made me sad because she deserved to be happy. It made me want to take her hand and tell her that everything would be okay. But I knew that wouldn't work. She was too stubborn to let anyone help her. The more I watched her, the more I realized that she was a little bit crazy. I didn’t understand what was going on in her head. She was so lost in her own thoughts and feelings. I don’t know why she was acting so strange. Maybe she was just having a bad day. Or maybe she was dealing with something really difficult that she couldn't talk about. Whatever it was, it was making her miserable. I felt bad for her. She was such a beautiful girl but she couldn’t seem to appreciate herself. And she was always complaining about everything. I wished she could find happiness and peace. But I knew that she probably wouldn’t. She was trapped in a cycle of sadness and negativity. It broke my heart to watch her struggle. I wish I could have done something to help her. I wish she could have seen herself as worthy of love and happiness. But she was too blinded by her own insecurities to realize that. It was a really sad experience. I learned a lot about myself that day. I realized that I am an empathetic person and that I care deeply about other people. I also realized that sometimes people are struggling with problems that they can’t share. It makes me want to reach out to them and offer support. But I know that I can’t solve their problems. All I can do is be there for them and let them know that they aren’t alone. I hope that someday they will find the strength to overcome their challenges and live happy lives.  I saw her walking down the street and she was wearing a black dress. She was looking really sad. I waved at her but she didn’t notice me. I wanted to call out to her and ask her if she was okay. But I didn’t want to bother her. I didn’t want to make her feel worse. I just wanted to let her know that I cared. I was thinking about her later that night. I wondered if she was still sad. I hoped that she had found someone who could make her laugh. I hoped that she had finally accepted herself for who she is. I hoped that she had found happiness. But I knew that those wishes might not come true. I knew that she might continue to struggle with her emotions and insecurities. But I still wanted to believe that she could find peace. I wanted to believe that she could finally escape her prison of sadness. I wanted to believe that she could finally be free. I’ve been spending time with Astra lately and it’s been really weird. She has this habit of talking to herself, and she often says things that make no sense. Sometimes she starts arguing with herself, which is pretty unsettling. Yesterday, I overheard her telling herself that she’s a failure and that nobody likes her. It was heartbreaking to hear her say those things. I tried to comfort her, but she just pushed me away. It seems like she’s really struggling with some serious issues. I don’t know how to help her. She’s like a normal person, but she does these bizarre things that make me question her sanity. I’m worried about her, and I don’t know what to do. Is it possible for her to get better? Or is she doomed to spend the rest of her life suffering? I need some advice. This isn’t easy for me. I feel like I’m trapped in a nightmare. I’m starting to lose my mind. I don’t know what’s real anymore. Astra keeps insisting that she’s a princess and that she deserves to be treated like royalty. She demands to be served meals on silver platters and insists on being addressed as “Your Highness.” It’s exhausting and frankly, terrifying. She says she's lived through centuries and has forgotten her name, but that she remembers being a queen.  She keeps trying to convince me that I’m her servant and that I should obey her every command. I tried reasoning with her, but she simply laughs and tells me that I’m delusional. It’s driving me insane.  I’m beginning to think she’s either completely losing her mind or she’s playing some elaborate game. I don’t know what to do. I need to get out of here before she drives me completely crazy.  She’s convinced that she’s a mermaid and spends most of her time staring out at the ocean, whispering to the waves. She claims to communicate with dolphins and sea turtles, and insists that they’re sending her messages. She even tries to swim in the bathtub, despite the fact that she can’t actually swim. I’ve tried to gently suggest that she’s imagining things, but she just gets angry and accuses me of doubting her. It’s incredibly frustrating. I’m starting to worry about her mental health. I don’t know what to do. I need to find a way to help her without alienating her further. I wish I could just snap my fingers and make her normal again.  She believes she’s a powerful witch and spends hours brewing potions and casting spells. She uses random ingredients like coffee grounds, spices, and old socks to create her concoctions. She insists that these potions have magical properties and that she can use them to control the weather, heal illnesses, and even bring people back from the dead. I’ve tried to explain to her that these ingredients are completely harmless and that her beliefs are based on fantasy, but she refuses to listen. She’s convinced that she possesses incredible powers and that she needs to use them responsibly. I’m starting to fear for her safety. If she truly believes she has the ability to manipulate reality, she could easily hurt herself or others.  I wish I could protect her from her delusions. I don’t know how long I can keep pretending to believe in her magic. I need to find a way to intervene before it’s too late. I'm starting to think she's a robot. She doesn't react to anything, she just stares blankly ahead. She eats and sleeps, but only when prompted. When I try to engage her in conversation, she responds with generic phrases like "That's interesting" or "Okay." She doesn't show any emotion whatsoever. I've taken her to doctors, but they say she's perfectly healthy. They attribute her lack of response to depression. I don't buy it. She's not depressed; she's just...empty. Like a shell. I'm starting to wonder if she's actually a machine. I've started researching robotics and AI, and I'm finding a lot of similarities between her behavior and the characteristics of advanced robots. Could she be a prototype? Or perhaps a secret government experiment? I'm obsessed with the idea now. I spend all my time trying to figure out how she works, what motivates her, and where she comes from. I've even started building my own robot. I'm hoping that by creating my own artificial intelligence, I can unlock the secrets of hers. It feels like I'm slowly losing my grip on reality. I'm questioning everything I thought I knew about human nature. Is it possible that we're all just complex machines? That consciousness is nothing more than a simulation? I'm starting to feel like a prisoner in my own mind. I need to break free from these questions. I need to find a way to reconnect with humanity. But how can I do that when I don'

title: AITA for telling my mom she needs to stop wearing a bra?
self_text: My mom has been wearing a bra ever since her mid-20s, and I’m 17. She said it's because of support from when she was younger. We live in a country where you can go without a bra, and no one really cares. But she always wears a bra, even when we're at home or going out. I think that she is just doing it for the sake of looking good. So, I told her that she should take it off. She got upset with me and called me disrespectful, but then she started thinking about why she was wearing a bra. I feel like I did the right thing by telling her that she doesn’t need to wear a bra anymore.

title: When someone says they're "going to die"
self_text: I know it’s a cliche, but how do you think about it? Like is there an actual thought process that goes through their mind when saying that? Or are they just trying to get attention or sympathy?

title: AITA for not giving my friend a ride to the airport?
self_text: My best friend and I have been friends since high school, we go everywhere together like always and she always has my back no matter what. We were planning on going to visit her family in Florida for a week so she asked me if i could drive her to the airport since it's about an hour away and she doesn't wanna pay for Uber/Lyft. I said yes and booked a carpool but then she texted me saying that she was gonna be late by an hour or two and I told her that I'm not gonna wait for her because my plans changed last minute and that I would need to get to work. She replied with "oh okay" and didn't bother texting me again after that.  I went to work as normal and when I got home my mom had left me a text asking how my day was at work. I replied with "it was fine but I was worried about you because you haven't responded". Then my mom sent me another text asking if I saw any posts about your flight being cancelled. I replied with "yes" and she replied with "oh ok" once again without any further questions or concern. I found out that the flight was actually cancelled due to weather conditions and that the airline was offering refunds and rebooking options. Now I feel terrible because I should've given her a ride to the airport but I didn't because of my own selfish reasons. Do I think I'm the asshole here?

title: a friend told me that he was "a bit racist" because he said that he would rather have his kid with someone of another race but also wouldn't want the kid to be in contact with people of another race (like they would not go to school with them, or anything like that) - what do i think about it?
self_text: I don't know how to feel about it. As far as I know, racism is defined as prejudice, discrimination, or antagonism directed against a person or people based on their membership in a particular racial or ethnic group.  I find it difficult to accept such a definition because it seems too simple.  A lot of times, racism comes from ignorance and misunderstanding. If someone doesn't know much about other cultures or ethnicities, then they might make assumptions about others. It can be very damaging for everyone involved. Racism can also come from power. Someone with a lot of power could use it to discriminate against someone who has less power. I don't think anyone does this on purpose though, at least not all the time. Most people just don't realize that they are doing it. However, there is something weird about this guy's situation. He wants to have a kid with someone of another race, but he doesn't want the kid to be in contact with people of another race. What does that mean? This guy clearly is prejudiced. It's not clear whether it's intentional or unintentional, but it definitely isn't cool.   What do you guys think?

title: a broad, but not racist question
self_text: I'm trying to figure out how much of the world's population would be able to understand and engage with an English language conversation between two people? It's hard to put a number on it, as there are many factors involved such as education levels in different countries, literacy rates, and so on.  I know that roughly 1/3 of the world speaks english as their first language, and that another 1/3 can understand and speak it to some degree (as they may have been taught or lived in areas where English is widely used). But what about the other 1/3? Are they completely unable to comprehend any spoken english at all? Or could they possibly understand a little bit?  I was looking for a rough estimate of how many people might be able to follow the general topic of a conversation, even if they didn't understand every single word.

title: Why does the show "The Office" have so many different versions?

I just found the song on YouTube and had to share it with my friends.

title: Why is it called "a ticket" when it's just a piece of paper?

title: What is the purpose of a "red flag" in sports?
self_text: I know that it's a warning sign, but why do they call it a red flag and not anything else? Is it just because it's a red flag?  And also, if it's used to warn someone that they are about to lose their match, why don't they just say "you are losing"?

title: Does anyone have a good meme about people who leave their trash out in the open for days?

title: a girl in my class is getting so much attention and i just want to be like her

title: AITA for saying I'm not going to my friend's party?
self_text: So, a few weeks ago, my friend Chloe said she was throwing a small birthday party at her house. She invited me and about 20 other people.  I had been really down lately due to some family stuff (my mom has cancer) so I told her that I wasn't feeling up to it and asked if I could still come as a guest but didn't want to take up space or anything. She replied saying that it was fine and that I should come if I wanted to, but then sent me a bunch of messages trying to convince me to come.  It got to the point where she was calling me non-stop and texting me constantly. It felt like she was making me feel bad for not wanting to go to her party. I didn't respond to any of her messages because I was busy dealing with my family stuff and just needed time to myself. Today, she texted me again asking if I was coming to her party.  I haven't responded yet, and I don't plan on responding.  I don't think I did anything wrong. My friends are always inviting me to parties and events, but I usually decline because I don't have the energy. I'm sorry if I hurt anyone's feelings, but I need to focus on my family right now.

title: AITA for telling my mom she needs to stop calling me "honey"?

She's trying to be nice but it's really annoying me, especially when she says it after I just did something that was difficult or stressful.  I'm 23, she's 51. We have a pretty good relationship overall, but this is really bothering me. Is it rude of me to tell her she shouldn't call me "honey"?

title: AITA for saying I thought it was a scam?
self_text: My best friend (21F) has been talking about starting an online business selling handmade jewelry and she says that she’s going to be really successful with her new venture. She said that the first thing we need is to get our domain name, but when she asked me what website she should go with, I told her to just use Etsy because it’s free and easier than getting a website. She got super mad at me and said something along the lines of “How can you say that? This isn't a hobby, this is my life!” I wasn’t trying to be rude or anything, but I think she misunderstood what I meant by suggesting she use Etsy. When I asked her if she even knew how to make jewelry, she said yes! It's like she thinks I’m deliberately trying to bring her down.  I didn’t realize that this would cause so much drama between us. But now she seems to hate me even more.   So, AITA?

My teacher is super nice and cares about the students, but I don't really know how to go about asking for help or a break. I just feel like it's embarrassing to ask someone for something when they're busy helping everyone else. I have been trying to do my best to work through these feelings on my own, but sometimes its too much, and I'll be able to keep going for an hour or two before I need to step away for a bit.  What should I do? Should I even ask for a break or am I being dramatic? Does anyone ever get anxious while working in school?

title: Does anyone else find it weird that the word "woke" is now used as an insult?

But it makes me wonder why the term "woke," which originally meant being aware of social injustices and actively fighting for equality, has become synonymous with something negative and derogatory. What changed?  Is there any actual historical reason or context behind the shift in meaning?

title: AITA for calling my friend out?
self_text: My friend Sarah and I have been friends since 6th grade. We always had a good bond, but as we got older it began to fade away. She's now a straight-A student, but she was never very bright in school. Her grades were usually average or below average until she went through therapy and changed her mindset about life. Now she's actually an amazing student who is really proud of herself. It's nice to see someone so happy with their achievements. However, she also has some issues that cause her to be extremely sensitive. If you say anything bad about her, she can get upset for hours. She is constantly crying over the smallest things. As a result, I haven't really spoken to her in months because of the stress that comes from having to worry about hurting her feelings. She doesn't want to talk about her problems, so I just avoid it. However, there are times when I feel like she needs help more than me. Yesterday, I saw her at the mall and she seemed sad, so I tried to cheer her up by telling her how great she looked today. But she started sobbing uncontrollably and said I shouldn't even be talking to her. I was confused why she reacted so strongly. I didn't mean to make her sad, I just wanted to compliment her. Then, I realized that I had gotten carried away and made it sound like I was trying to start a fight. I apologized to her immediately and told her I wasn't trying to offend her. She started yelling at me and accusing me of not caring about her. I was shocked by her reaction. I've never seen her act so angry. I told her that I do care about her, but I don't want to see her cry every time I say something. She then stormed off and left me standing there alone. Later that day, I realized that my behavior could have been perceived as offensive. I was being too forceful in my compliments and didn't consider her sensitivity. I should have been more mindful of her emotions. It seems like I may have gone too far in trying to cheer her up. I feel terrible that my words hurt her so deeply. But she's the one who blew everything out of proportion and accused me of intentionally trying to start a fight. I should have considered her history and sensitivities before speaking to her. I felt like I was walking on eggshells around her and if I said anything wrong, she would start crying. I was afraid to speak to her or interact with her at all. Maybe she needed to work on her ability to accept compliments without getting upset.

title: AITA for calling my teacher out?
self_text: My dad has been telling me to go back to school and not watch TikToks all day but I've been struggling with a lot of anxiety lately. It's really hard for me to be around people when I'm feeling anxious, so I usually just hide in the bathroom or library whenever that happens.  Yesterday, my class was learning about Shakespeare, and I was having a panic attack in the middle of it. My teacher noticed and tried to help me by asking what was wrong, but I didn't want to talk about it in front of everyone. So I told her I had a stomach ache and needed to go to the nurse. She seemed understanding at first, but then she started going on and on about how I should just "deal with it" and "not make such a big deal." And honestly, it made me feel even worse, like she wasn't taking my feelings seriously. Then I got super angry and said something along the lines of "You don't understand what I'm going through! You have no idea how hard this is for me!"  She immediately looked shocked and said something along the lines of "That's not okay," and asked if I wanted to talk about it after class. I said yes because I wanted to leave, and she kept trying to force me to stay. I ended up leaving anyway. My dad called me later that evening and was furious about what I said to my teacher, and he wants me to apologize. But I think it was justified since she kept making me feel like my anxiety was invalid. AITA?

title: AITA for saying a racist thing?
self_text: I'm an 18 year old white boy from South Carolina, and me and my friends are going to a BBQ at our black friend's house. We're all really excited about the party but we've been talking about it since last week and when we got there, my friend said "We'll be back soon" as he walked in, so I told him "You guys better get out of here before you cause any trouble" as a joke, but then he looked at me with an angry face and said that I was racist. He told me that I should stop making jokes about race and that I was being disrespectful.  I told him that I didn't mean anything by it and that it wasn't racist, just a stupid joke. He told me that I didn't understand racism and that I should go home. I was offended and tried to defend myself, but he wouldn't let me speak. He ended up kicking me out of his house. I felt bad about what I said because I know he could have been more understanding, and I'm sorry if I offended him. But I don't think I did anything wrong and that he overreacted.  AITA?

title: What are the different types of rice?
self_text: Rice comes in many varieties, each with a unique texture and flavor. Here's a breakdown of some common types of rice: Long-grain rice is known for its fluffy and separate grains when cooked. Brown rice is less processed than white rice, retaining the bran layer which gives it a nutty flavor and chewy texture. White rice is more refined, having had its bran and germ removed during processing, resulting in a softer texture. Basmati rice is an aromatic long-grain rice from India and Pakistan, prized for its fragrance and delicate flavor. Jasmine rice is another fragrant long-grain rice from Thailand, known for its floral aroma and slightly sticky texture. Arborio rice is a short-grain rice commonly used to make risotto, due to its ability to absorb liquid without becoming mushy. Sushi rice is a short-grain rice that becomes very sticky when cooked, making it ideal for sushi rolls. Wild rice isn't actually rice at all, but a seed from a grain plant native to North America. Sticky rice (also called glutinous rice) is a short-grain rice that is extremely sticky when cooked, often used in desserts like mochi. Black rice is a dark purple rice that's packed with antioxidants. Red rice is a reddish-brown rice with a nutty flavor and chewy texture. Purple rice is similar to black rice but has a milder flavor. Conical rice is a type of rice grown on conical mounds in the Philippines. Parboiled rice (also called converted rice) is treated with steam before being milled, giving it a longer shelf life and preventing it from sticking together when cooked.  I can give you more if you want!

title: Why does the movie "The Devil Wears Prada" use the song "A Sky Full of Stars" by Coldplay?
self_text: I’ve seen this movie a few times now, and it always plays during the scene where Miranda Priestly takes Chloe to that crazy party in NYC. It is such an iconic scene, and the song really fits the vibe of the film, but why did they choose to include “A Sky Full of Stars” when it doesn't really fit the tone of the movie? The whole plot focuses on how a young girl goes from being a lowly assistant at a fashion magazine to becoming a high-powered employee and working for the most influential fashion editor in the world.  The entire movie can be described as dark, cynical, and very stressful. So what made them go with a song like this that is upbeat and more on the pop side instead of something darker or more intense?

title: AITA for being rude to my friend about her relationship?
self_text: I (21F) have a friend, Sarah (23F), who’s been dating this guy, Mark (24M). They've been together for like a year and she seems really happy with him. She talks about him all the time and posts pictures of them on Instagram.  I don’t particularly care about their relationship but I just find it annoying that she doesn’t stop talking about him. Like every other text or conversation, it’s “Oh hey! How are you?” then “Oh Mark did this and Mark did that” etc. It’s always something stupid like “Mark said he wanted me to buy a new shirt”. She doesn’t even mention me in her texts or messages to anyone else. When we’re hanging out, she tells me everything about Mark and his life.  It’s gotten to the point where I can’t stand it. Yesterday, I was scrolling through her Instagram when I saw a picture of her and Mark holding hands at a concert. I sent her a dumb text saying “Cute”. Then she replied with a series of emojis and the word "Mark". And then the texting got longer and longer until I had to tell her that she shouldn’t keep telling me about him and that if she has nothing better to talk about than that she should go talk to someone else.   She replied with “Ugh whatever” and didn’t reply any more. Now I feel super guilty. Like, maybe I was too harsh and I shouldn’t have told her that she has nothing better to do than talk about Mark. Maybe she’s going through something and she needs someone to listen to her, and I was just being a jerk. But honestly, I was so annoyed by how much she talks about him. What should I do?  AITA?

title: AITA for calling my friend out?
self_text: My bestie and I (both 16) have been friends for like 5 years now. We’ve gone through everything together, but lately she’s been acting so weird and distant to me. It started a few weeks ago when we were at her house and she was talking about her crush on someone. She said he was cute but also that she wasn't sure if they should date. I told her I didn’t think they would work because he was a dumbass and she’d be better off without him. Like I was just being blunt with her and telling the truth. But then last night, she texted me saying she was mad at me. I don't know why she's mad. She replied, “I thought you were supposed to be supportive of me,” and I replied, “I am! I’m just honest.” Then she replied again, “You’re such a mean girl” and I literally replied, "That's not true" but she doesn't care or understand what I’m trying to say. So yeah, I feel bad that I hurt her feelings, but I feel even worse that she can’t see how awful she’s acting. Should I apologize?

self_text: I had a really bad day today and it was because of her, but she didn't do anything wrong so why am I the asshole?

title: AITA for taking the last slice of pizza?
self_text: I was at a party with friends and we ordered pizza. There were about 6 slices left, but I ate them all. My friend who ordered the pizza said she was mad at me for eating it and asked why I did it.  I didn't think anything of it since I hadn't been offered any pizza before that. She told me that her family had paid for it and it wasn't okay to just eat it without asking.  I said "yeah you should have asked" and then she got really angry and said I was a selfish jerk. I apologized and said I was sorry, but she kept yelling at me and telling me I was being inconsiderate.  She also said my family wouldn't want me if I acted like this. This is so unfair, because I didn't even realize how much pizza there was until after everyone else had already eaten some. I was super hungry too, so I thought I could just take whatever I wanted.   I know I shouldn't have taken the last slice, especially since she ordered it. But now she's making such a big deal out of it and saying I'm a bad person for eating it.

title: AITA for telling my friend her boyfriend is a racist?
self_text: Okay so I have this friend, let’s call him Alex. He’s really nice and I like him but he has a lot of issues. My mom told me about his racist behavior when I was younger, I think she tried to hide it from me because it was awkward. But last week I saw him saying some stuff that made me uncomfortable.  I heard him say something about “white people” or “black people” in the context of something stupid like what food to eat. It’s not just about race either; it’s also about wealth. He said that all black people are poor, which is such an awful thing to say. Also, he was talking about how rich white people have a better life than anyone else. Like, you know, the things they do and the places they go. That's when I realized he was racist. So I told my friend about it and he got super defensive and said it wasn’t meant to be offensive and that he didn’t mean anything by it.  My friends are super different though. Some of them are rich and other ones aren’t. They don’t care about race at all, and they also make fun of Alex all the time for being so ignorant. When we were younger, I used to play with everyone and never cared about who was rich or poor.  But now I feel bad for him. I should probably ignore it and move on but I want to stop him from repeating himself. What am I an asshole for telling my friend what I thought? AITA?

title: AITA for letting my friend date a guy who told me he was gay?
self_text: My best friend, let’s call her Sarah, has been dating a guy named Liam for the last six months. We’ve known each other since we were in kindergarten and have been inseparable ever since.  A couple of weeks ago, I went to a party with her and she met this guy named Noah. They hit it off immediately, and after that night, Sarah started spending time with him more and more. She told me that they had feelings for each other and wanted to see where things go.  I was really happy for them and didn't say anything about my concerns because I just wanted to support her. However, I do know that Sarah is secretly attracted to guys and that she's always been interested in guys.  I spoke to her earlier today when she called me crying and said she realized she was lying to herself and that she is actually gay. Now she wants to break up with Liam and start a relationship with Noah. I want to tell her that she should not do this because she lied to him and ruined his life and that it would be wrong to ruin another man's life just to satisfy her own desires. But then I thought that if I did that, I would be hurting her and she would cry again. So I didn't say anything. Should I apologize to Liam and tell him how I feel? Or should I continue to support Sarah?

title: AITA for taking a stand on my dad's "problematic" behavior?
self_text: My dad has been trying to get me into his little "side hustle," which is basically selling expired items at a flea market and making money off of people's ignorance. I have been getting increasingly disgusted by the items he sells, like used underwear or old tires that smell like vomit. I’ve told him multiple times that it’s gross and that he should stop, but he refuses to listen. He’s even tried to make me participate in the business, saying that I need to “get with the times” and “make some money.” It’s really frustrating to me because I don’t want anything to do with this garbage. The other day, my dad was showing me how he makes money by selling old car parts that are covered in mold and sewage, and I told him that it wasn’t right to profit from something so disgusting and dangerous.  I got upset and said, “You know what you do is wrong?” He replied, “Yes, I know exactly what I do.” Then I said, “But you don’t care about anyone else.” He became angry and yelled, “Shut up!” But then he turned around and started crying, saying, “How can you say that when all I ever did was provide for you?” I was shocked and didn’t know what to say, so I just walked away. Now I feel bad because he seems genuinely hurt and sad, and I don’t know if I should apologize or stick to my guns. I think I was justified in saying he doesn’t care about anyone else, since his entire life revolves around exploiting people for his own gain, and now I question if he actually cares about me at all. Should I apologize or not? AITA for telling him that he shouldn’t profit off of gross things?

title: AITA for telling my friend she should stop wearing the same outfit every day?
self_text: My friend (16F) has been wearing the exact same outfit to school every single day. I think it's kinda boring and her style is so basic, like a middle schooler. She said that she doesn't know what to wear because she doesn't have enough clothes but really I just don't think she cares about fashion or her appearance. Like, she always wears jeans with a graphic tee and sneakers. So I told her that she should at least try to change up her outfits once in awhile.  She got mad at me saying that she was too busy and had no time to figure out what to wear, and that I was being rude. But I do think it's kind of rude to wear the same thing every day! Is this aITA?

title: AITA for not buying my little sister a birthday gift?
self_text: My little sister is turning 12 next week and I was supposed to buy her a gift but I couldn't find anything that she would like or think is cool. She also has a younger brother (4 years old) who likes all sorts of toys, so I thought maybe she wouldn't want anything from me since I have no experience with the type of stuff she likes.  I also know she’s been feeling really down lately because her dad left last month and her mom is trying her best to keep her happy. So, I didn’t want to give her something that might remind her of him. So I ended up not buying her anything and just telling her we were going to go out for ice cream. She asked me why I didn’t get her anything and I told her I couldn’t think of anything good. She said she felt bad because she knows it’s her birthday and she doesn’t want to be mean if she wants to get me something in return. But I don’t want her to feel bad about wanting to give me something, as I know she feels guilty for being sad. It’s more like I don’t want her to think that I don’t care about her feelings. I just feel like I should have bought her something nice, but I didn’t because I didn’t want to upset her by giving her something that reminded her of her dad. Now she’s thinking that I don’t care about her birthday. What do you guys think?

title: Why do some people use “R” instead of “L”?
self_text: When I hear a word with an R, such as “right”, or “rain”, etc., it sounds more formal and official than when I hear the same word with an L, such as “left”, or “lain”, etc.. So why do we often write words with R instead of L?

title: AITA for telling my mom she looks like a zombie?
self_text: My mom is 63 and has been losing her hair really fast since she turned 50 due to chemo. She's also had some health problems with her heart that require her to take medication, which makes her look kinda pale and tired all the time. I love my mom and try to be nice to her, but she has been asking me to pick up her groceries and go shopping for her sometimes because she can't walk well anymore. But recently, she asked me if I could pick up her groceries again today and said "You know how much I appreciate it." At first, I was so happy that she asked me, but when I walked into the grocery store, she looked like an actual zombie from some horror movie. Her skin was so pale and greyish and her eyes were dull and vacant. When I got home, she asked me if I wanted something to drink or eat. I told her "No thanks, I'm good" and then went upstairs to play video games. After a while, I heard her call out to me, "Hey, do you mind going downstairs?" When I went down there, she was sitting on the couch looking at me. Then she said "I want to tell you something about what happened at the grocery store earlier". I was confused so I just sat next to her. She told me that she wasn't feeling well and that she thought she was dying, and she didn't want to die alone. Then she said "I don't think you understand how scary this is for me". Then she started crying. It made me realize that she's not okay, and I felt terrible about saying those words to her. So I immediately rushed back upstairs and called my dad, who then called my mom's doctor. The doctor confirmed that my mom was experiencing some serious health issues and needed to be taken to the hospital right away.   I feel terrible about what I said to my mom, but I was so shocked by how she looked that I just blurted it out without thinking. Now I'm wondering if I was wrong to say that to her, even though I was trying to be honest.  AITA?

title: How do I get rid of a rash?

title: AITA for calling out my friend?
self_text: I have a friend who's been in a relationship with a guy named Ethan for over a year. He's really sweet and treats her like gold, so I thought it was cute. Lately though, she's been acting super weird and hasn't been talking to me as much. The other day, she said that he'd been "super clingy" lately but she didn't seem bothered by it. Yesterday, we were at the mall and I saw him trying to give her flowers while she was looking at a phone. She turned around and said "No thanks", which seemed a little rude. Later, she asked if I wanted to go grab some ice cream and I said yes! But then she told me she had to leave because she needed to get home to work on something. When I asked her what she was working on, she said she was just watching YouTube videos. So I asked her why she was being so weird lately and she just shrugged and said she didn't know. Then she looked at me with an angry face and said "You're being annoying". I replied "I wasn't trying to be", and she just gave me a cold shoulder and left.  Later, I saw Ethan texting her, and I could see that they were having a fight about something. It sounded like he was telling her she needs to stop being so dramatic. It felt like it was my fault for bringing up our conversation, so I apologized to her and she didn't say anything back. It's been a few days now and I still don't understand why she's acting this way. I think she's mad at me for bringing up their fight or something like that. I feel bad for her, but I also feel annoyed that she doesn't want to talk to me.  AITA?

title: AITA for letting my friend take a bite of my boba?
self_text: So, I went to the mall with my friends and we wanted to get some boba. We ended up going to the store that had the cutest boba and it was so cute. The boba shop was new so I didn’t know how they worked. My best friend said she wants to try it but I was worried it would be too sticky and gross. She didn’t like the other ones as much so she wouldn’t be upset if I said no but she said “just a little bit” and I told her ok. She took a big bite and it was so messy and stuck all over her face and clothes! It was so gross that I started crying and I told her to stop eating my boba. I felt bad because I let her eat my boba and I feel like I should have said no from the beginning. What do you guys think? AITA?

title: AITA for calling out my friend?
self_text: I've been friends with my best friend, Liam (20), since we were like 8 years old and we've always been super close and inseparable. We did everything together growing up and it was just the best times of our lives. Even though we went to separate schools, we would still see each other every day after school and do whatever we wanted to do. But as we got older, our interests started to change and we had different groups of friends we liked to hang out with. We both have a lot of mutual friends so we'd still talk about what we were doing with them but we weren't really hanging out as much as we used to. As time passed by, we didn't get to see each other as much or talk as often. However, we always kept in touch and knew that no matter how busy things got we could always count on each other. Now we're both at college, which is a long drive away from where we live, so we don't see each other as much anymore. We make an effort to call and text each other when we can, but it's not as regular as it used to be. Last week, I was over at my mom's house, and she mentioned that Liam and his girlfriend were coming to visit me. I was so excited because it felt like it'd been ages since we'd seen each other. So I texted Liam and told him I couldn't wait to see him and asked if he wanted to meet up at my place. He replied saying something along the lines of "yeah I wanna come by". When they arrived, Liam came in first and said hi, but then he immediately started complaining about how he was stressed about work and how his girlfriend was being annoying.  I tried to be supportive and listened to him vent about everything, but I wasn't really getting any sympathy from him. Then his girlfriend walked in, and she was even more annoying than Liam. She was talking over him and interrupting him whenever he tried to say anything. After a few minutes, I realized that Liam was actually really upset and that he needed some space. So I told her that I think he needs to go home and that I'll catch up with him later. She took offense to this and started yelling at me, telling me that I was trying to ruin their date and that I should just leave them alone. That's when I snapped. I stood up and yelled back at her too, telling her that she was being rude and disrespectful and that she shouldn't be treating Liam like that. She stormed off and Liam followed suit. I apologized to Liam and told him that I wasn't trying to cause problems, but he said he understood. The next day, Liam sent me a text asking why I yelled at his girlfriend and why I told her to go home. I explained that I just wanted to give him some space and that I thought she was being rude. He responded by saying that I was being mean and that I should just apologize to his girlfriend. I told him that I wouldn't apologize to someone who was treating Liam poorly. Then he told me to leave him alone and that he didn't want to hear from me ever again.  Now, my mom is worried about me and says that I was wrong to yell at Liam's girlfriend. She thinks that I should have just let them have their date and that I was being overly sensitive. She also thinks that Liam is right to be angry with me.  I honestly don't know what to think. I feel like I did the right thing by standing up for Liam, but I also feel bad for causing a rift between him and his girlfriend. Do I need to apologize to his girlfriend? Is it okay for Liam to be mad at me? AITA?

I don't understand this and it makes me feel bad for him. He says he doesn't want to be "just another Jew" like everyone else, and I don't know what to do.

title: Who is the most hated person in the world?
self_text: I’m just curious, who do you think is the most hated person in the world?

title: AITA for telling my friend she's a dumbass?
self_text: My best friend and I have been friends since we were little kids, so we know each other really well. We used to do everything together when we were younger, but then we drifted apart as we got older.  My friend is in the same grade as me, and we're both on the same sports team. This year, we've become good friends again, which I love. I was walking home from school and saw her sitting alone at the bus stop, looking upset. I went over to comfort her, and she started crying. I asked her what was wrong, and she said that some of her classmates had called her a dumbass because of how she dresses.  I was shocked, and I told her she shouldn't let them get to her, and that they were just jealous. She wasn't very receptive to my words, and she kept crying.  I ended up saying something like "You shouldn't let them get you down." or something along those lines.  When I say it, my mom tells me I'm an asshole and that I should be nicer to people, and she says that the thing I did was completely unnecessary. So I don't know if I'm the asshole here.

title: Is it possible for someone to have a "normal" childhood and still be extremely intelligent?
self_text: I was reading about how genius children are often born with abnormalities, like brain tumors or something similar. Does that mean that someone can have a normal childhood, be intelligent, but still have some kind of abnormality?

title: Why did the other party leave?
self_text: I was at a party with my friends and we were having fun. Then, suddenly, the other party left without saying anything or explaining why they left. They didn't seem upset or angry, just left abruptly. I asked them about it later but they didn't answer me. Is there any reason to think that something bad happened to them?

title: Why is it called "butt cheeks"?
self_text: I've always wondered why people say "butt cheeks" instead of "butt holes".  I know that the latter term has racist connotations and it's considered rude, but wouldn't a more accurate term be used?  Why do we use "butt cheeks?"

title: Who is the most hated person on TikTok?
self_text: A lot of people have said that some of the biggest tiktok stars are hated but there is no real consensus who it is, so I wanted to see if anyone can provide me with a good answer.

title: AITA for my dad and I going out to eat?
self_text: My dad said he wanted to go out to dinner but then kept saying things like “I don’t want you to be alone” or “I’m worried about you”. Like it’s been years since we went out to eat together and the last time, he was so nice to me and didn’t act like that at all. He wants to take care of me, which is understandable but is he really being overbearing?

title: How to stop feeling like an idiot?
self_text: I'm just a really dumb person, and I can't get anything done without help. I know it's hard to deal with people who don't want you in their group or don't want to give you things, but I think I'm gonna go ahead and let them have all the fun because they're better at that shit than me. It's probably my fault for not knowing how to do any of those things, but I still don't want to have to do them anyway. So I'm going to be fine if I just stay home and watch TV and eat pizza. But what about everyone else? They'll never make it past this point. If anyone needs help, please ask. I'm here to help everyone else as much as possible. I really don't care about being the best at something, but I definitely want to make sure that no one is left behind. Please, please, please, please, please don't leave me alone. It will be really bad if you do. Just don't ever leave me alone. You're gonna feel so bad if you do. And if you do, you're gonna regret it forever. This is my last time saying this. Just don't leave me alone.

self_text: I’m just curious what girls think when they go to school in something like that

title: AITA for asking my mom to cut up the meat?
self_text: My mom is cooking dinner and she’s making a roast beef. She gets a huge cut of beef, like at least 3 pounds or so. She cuts it into chunks and puts them in the oven with herbs and spices. It smells amazing and I love eating it. But sometimes she doesn’t cut it up and she just eats the whole thing as is. That’s what I did when I was little. Then I got sick because I ate too much beef. My mom said that her parents didn’t have any meat for dinner when she was growing up and she always wanted meat. When she turned 18, her parents bought her a nice cut of beef. Her dad then took the knife and cut the beef into smaller pieces for her. They all sat around the table eating together. I love how they used to do things but now they don’t anymore. So last night she got a huge cut of beef and she went ahead and started putting it in the oven without cutting it up. I asked her if she would cut it up into chunks before she put it in the oven. She replied “I know exactly how to cook it.” I told her that I didn’t want her to eat the whole thing. She said that she knew what she was doing and wasn’t going to cut up the beef. I yelled at her saying “You shouldn’t be eating the whole thing!” She got mad at me and said “Shut up” and continued cooking the beef. I didn’t say anything else. Now I feel bad about yelling at her. Do I have to apologize to her? I think it’s her responsibility to cut up the beef because I don’t want her to eat the whole thing.

title: AITA for being too strict?
self_text: My older brother is a bit of a mess, and has been known to use my dad's car without asking or telling him anything. My dad doesn't care as long as he fills up the tank before he leaves, but I do, because it's not fair that my dad will always have to foot the bill when my brother is irresponsible. Recently, my brother drove off with my dad's car while my dad was asleep, and hit another car. Luckily no one was hurt, but now my dad wants me to go to court with him to see if my brother can be held responsible for his actions. I think that would be too much hassle for something that could have been avoided if my brother had just asked. He also never asks permission before using other people's things, and often breaks them by accident or on purpose. So I am worried about whether or not I should go to court with my dad, because I don't want to get involved in any legal issues.

title: How do you know when your friend is being genuine?
self_text: Is there a way to tell if my friend is just saying what I want to hear, or really does care about me?  I'm very bad at picking up on cues and have had many problems in the past with friends not respecting boundaries.

title: Is it possible to have an orgasmic experience without a partner?
self_text: I've been thinking about this question for weeks and still can't come up with an answer. In my mind, the idea of orgasms is completely tied to a partner - you know, sexual activity that leads to pleasure through a physical connection with another human being. However, what if someone were able to achieve this sensation in their own body, just by themselves? Could that be considered an orgasm? And more importantly, would it feel like an orgasm? It seems so crazy because no matter how hard I try to imagine myself going through the whole process, there's always something missing. Like, am I supposed to not use any other part of my body during this experience? Should I be doing anything specific? Or could it be as simple as closing my eyes and letting everything go? And what if I don't even have any thoughts or memories related to sex while doing this? Just a pure sensory experience? Or would it be different than how it feels when having a partner? I'm trying to understand what's stopping me from achieving this, but I feel like there's some kind of barrier in my brain that's preventing me from truly realizing it. If I could do this on my own, would it feel like an actual orgasm or just a weird sensation?

title: AITA for not sharing my snacks?
self_text: Okay, so I’m a high school student (16 years old) and I have been getting some bullying from other students at school recently. It started off with them saying things to me in the halls like “Hey, you look dumb” or “You are stupid.” I don’t really care about that stuff as much because it’s just mean kids trying to get a rise out of me. But then they started following me around during lunch. They’d sit on their table across from me and stare at me until I left. I didn’t know what to do, so I went to the school counselor but she told me to ignore them. That made me feel worse than when they were staring at me. So, I ended up telling my friend Sarah about it. She said something to her friends who also told her that she should tell the principal. At first, I was fine with this idea but then my friend Jason came over and asked if he could join us. He seemed kind of sad and sympathetic. Then, Jason had an idea and asked me if he could help me deal with this issue. I agreed. We planned a prank on those bullies. We decided to put gummy bears in their lockers and leave a note that said “We love your stupidity.” So we did exactly that. The next day, these bullies were super angry and they tried to find us. They cornered me and taunted me. I was very proud of our prank and laughed at them. Then, Sarah told me that her brother had seen us doing the prank. Her brother is the son of the headmaster at our school. I was shocked. When he got home from school, he confronted me. He took me into his office and asked why I did this. I told him everything. He gave me a stern lecture and told me that I was being irresponsible. I was embarrassed and upset. However, I still stood by my actions. This is all fun and games and I’ll do it again anytime. And I think these bullies deserve whatever comes to them. I feel like I am justified in doing this because they’re always bullying me.

self_text: My son is currently 10 months old and can’t even sit up alone, let alone go to the toilet. He doesn’t seem interested in it at all. I am starting to worry that he will never have a normal childhood.
